title: Workshop on Mathematical Identity Formation Through Learning Community Participation

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of basic mathematical concepts (functions, calculus, probability, and statistics)
context.additional_context: Emphasis on learners exploring their identity through interaction during mathematical problem-solving processes

learning_goals: Learners write three or more reflective journals on mathematical thinking processes through learning community activities (discussions, collaborative problem-solving).

Incorporating peer feedback three or more times, learners create a 5-minute explanatory video on a math concept (e.g., derivatives, integrals, matrices), upload it to a sharing platform, and receive a rating of 4 or higher (5-point scale) in "clarity" and "accuracy" from at least two peers.

Learners analyze their role changes in three aspects (participation, contribution, leadership) within a learning community over one week, write a 500-character self-assessment report, and submit it with at least two clear examples.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
